intro: Eritrichium fetisowii, commonly known as the Tibetan mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia, including Tibet and the Himalayas. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant features basal leaves that are lobed and hairy, with small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in a cluster. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. Eritrichium fetisowii is adapted to cold climates and is often found in meadows and slopes at elevations above 3,000 meters.
